website_summaries.verdict: Premium legal-size briefcase is easy to maneuver through busy airports.
pros: High marks for its design and handsome yet durable material
Built to adhere to FAA regulations
Padded laptop sleeve carries up to 17 in
Several pockets for multiple digital devices, business cards, and more
cons: Reviews suggest low wheels may stick in certain circumstances

customer_reviews.title: Wish this bag was made better!
customer_reviews.text: The side pockets are glued and they became unglued and they flap around. The seams start to unravel. The lock fell off. The wheels are too low and close to the ground. Since it is low the bottom on the bag rubs on the street. This is our second bag. I don't even think it lasted a year before it started to unravel. It's such a nice big bag but it is poorly made. I purchased it because of it's size and depth. I have enclosed the pictures of the first bag.
customer_reviews.author: momof4kidz

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed! Returning this item
customer_reviews.text: I had to give this much anticipated case a 2 star rating because: 1. One of the locks would not open right after I open the case and set my combination lock! 2. There were no instructions on how to reset the lock! 3. The keyed front compartment won't open with the key! I should have trusted the reviews. Very disappointed! Returning this item.
customer_reviews.author: Lili Caulker

customer_reviews.title: Mine was of Poor Quality.
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely disappointed with this product. I have owned for about 9 months now. A month ago I noticed that the skin had cracked and separated along the fold of the top cover where it bends when you open the case. You can't get around using the fold because that is where it folds upon opening. Additionally, the latch on the front pocket broke after three months and the flaps on the external side pockets began to curl. Maybe I just got a bad case but it really looks bad. I would give this a zero rating if I could. I am really dissapointed in this case and cannot recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Prof

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy After Continious Use
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy so far and holding up well after about four continuous months of use. Appears to be constructed well or at a minimum better than many other cases available on Amazon. Happy thus far with the extra room this case provides as well as the ability to pull it behind you with the telescoping handle (and two straight wheels).
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for exhibitors
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag. It is wonderful for doing traveling exhibits. It has plenty of space to put lots of promotional materials. It is sturdy and well made. I am updating this after almost 2 years of use. I have stuffed it full of promotional materials and taken it on the road many places. I can even put my laptop and a projector in it. Other exhibitors who see it comment and ask where I got it. I would recommend this product to anyone looking for such a product. The pictures with my comment were taken recently - after all the use I write of. As you can see it has held up very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: michs

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case with tons of room but could use a few improvements.
customer_reviews.text: A great case for consultants bringing printed materials or documents. Could use some work on the little compartments for pencils and/or other small items. The hard plastic wheels are WAY TOO LOUD. They need to make them out of resilient rubber and lower the noise. When you're walking in a building with tile flooring, you clickety clack along invited stares. Otherwise its great.
customer_reviews.author: Good Old Freddie

customer_reviews.title: Both locks have now broken and won't even latch.
customer_reviews.text: One of the locks never locked (or even stayed latched) from the beginning. Seemed like it was missing an internal spring. I perservered, since I don't need to lock my case. Last week (6 months in, about 10 uses), the other lock just locked itself and no combination will open it. Had to pry the lock off the case (which turned out to be quite easy). Also one of the two sides doesn't open all the way without you holding it with one hand, because of the design. Also the extending handle is very wobbly. On the plus side, it looks quite nice.
customer_reviews.author: BlueSky

customer_reviews.title: Skip it!!! Bought this in Aug 2016 ...
customer_reviews.text: Skip it!!! Bought this in Aug 2016. In Mid Nov 2016, the retractable handle stuck closed and won't extend, so I can't use the wheels and must carry it. Can't return it either.
customer_reviews.author: EN

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The size is nice. If you are an infrequent traveler this case may be fine but I'm a frequent traveler and this case does not hold up. Any pressure to the top or sides will crack the fiberboard creating a permanent crease, the plastic ring on the top flap that overlaps the handle fell off on my third trip, the wheels (bearings) became loud on my fourth trip and the bearings gave out on my sixth trip. For the price I cant complain too much but I was hoping to get at least 1 year of travel of it but only got 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Bearings shot in four weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product in January for Spring semester. I live in Minnesota and park about a quarter mile from campus. I would make thew trip to and from campus four days a week. In four weeks the bearings in the wheels were shot, The noise was bad enough I had to start carrying it so I didn't disturb classrooms. For a product which claims to be so well built and cost as much as it does, I expect more.
customer_reviews.author: justin kent

customer_reviews.title: Wheels failed quickly
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great and was functionally exactly what was needed. Wheels we're relatively quiet, handle felt strong and space inside was good. I attempted to use everyday, and within 4 months the wheels failed. The integrity of the top deminished and handle frayed exposing cardboard stuffing which continued to come out until gone. The top latches stopped latching with ease as well. For the price, it's easily replaced after 4 months. And if you don't plan to use as an everyday attached, it will surely be a fine choice. The everyday use and exposure to sidewalks simply destroyed the wheels within just a few months.
customer_reviews.author: John K.

customer_reviews.title: Really durable case
customer_reviews.text: I hunted a long time for the proper solution to carrying presentations and folders, but hopefully, to not look like I was moving into someone's home when I visited. The case is extremely well built, strong and very durable. The case itself is light weight, but if you're looking for something like this, you'll be like me......it won't be light after you fill it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chad Stout

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Bought this seven months before I used it. I like a bag like this for the airplane on long trips because they hold masses of stuff. It proved way too big for my purposes. Couldn't get it in the overhead on a 767 transcontinental in Business Class. Despite the fact that I had bought it so long ago and had used it, the vendor accepted a return and gave me a full refund. Now that is classy. The bag is very well made. One flaw: no lock.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Alpine Swiss rolling file Case
customer_reviews.text: I got this thing to drag around medical files, leagal files and a laptop with cord, and mouse. This thing is huge and even fit my lunch too! The only thing I don’t care for is how it won’t stay open. The flap will just fold back over. No big deal tho. It locks and it rolls! It’s big and beefy! Worth every penny. I don’t look like a homeless person rolling this around. A good value if you need to look good and haul paperwork and a computer around.
customer_reviews.author: Siobhan Carr

customer_reviews.title: Our supervisor loves it.
customer_reviews.text: We (the office) bought this for the owner of our law firm. He stands out from the other attorneys who are hauling open crates full of binders to court. Since he's a scattered mess, the opportunity for organization is always welcome. We bought this early so we would have time to purchase a new gift if this wasn't up to standard and we're very pleased not to have to go back to the drawing board. Some deals are too good to be true, but this well-made professional looking carrier is a home run. He's been abusing it almost every work day since Christmas (throwing it in the trunk and wheeling it up courthouse steps) and it's still in excellent shape.
customer_reviews.author: Renita M.

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: Big mistake. You get what you pay form. Bad quality. Was defective on arrival. The frame/body was out of alignment and the bag couldn’t sit straight on the ground and kept on rattling. I had it shipped to Dubai and now can’t send it back due to the no international returns policy if Amazon! Total waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Yazid Tamimi

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy bag. Wheels not large enough to withstand ...
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy bag. Wheels not large enough to withstand shock. Also, wheels too small for such heavy bag. They're wearing out quite fast.
customer_reviews.author: Roxana Soltani

customer_reviews.title: Stylish, sturdy, and functional
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use as a mobile office. It is large enough to carry my files, laptop, portable printer and cords, with room to spare; Yet not so big that I couldn’t pick it up to carry by the top handle when not rolling it along behind me. I love the dual locks that secure the top. Very sturdy and stylish. I’ve received many compliments on this bag and recommend it to any professional that needs a case to carry more than just a few papers.
customer_reviews.author: Basemmel99

customer_reviews.title: At last a lap top briefcase with no pocket in the middle!
customer_reviews.text: My paper files, along with reference books, etc., can be large. Wi Fi is spotty in the courthouse and I need to be instantly prepared. The laptop pocket is not in the middle (Thank You!), it's in the back - I am able to fit my files, books, lap top, etc for a day away from the office. It rolls easily. I love the glasses pocket on the top inside, and pen slots. The large pocket in front fits a writing pad, tablet, etc. The side pocket is great for phone, extra supplies. It rolls easily. It is lightweight but good construction. When the handle is fully expanded it is tall enough for me (5'10").
customer_reviews.author: D shopper

customer_reviews.title: Cover flap hard to open and keep open
customer_reviews.text: I just received this bag. All seems to be ok. The only thing I really do not like about it is that the smaller of the top lids does not open easily. It is very stiff. Maybe with time, it will be more flexible. It is challenging to insert things into the bag since you have to fight with the flaps to keep it open. I will update this in the future if it gets better, which could increase my rating score.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Great product 👍🏻
customer_reviews.text: I use this to bring all my work equipment to work, we share desks. This product has really saved my joints and back!!
customer_reviews.author: Smile4red

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for price
customer_reviews.text: The construction is very good, and case had a lot of space. I use mine to carry some files for clinical practice and for teaching. There are enough compartments to handle both, and some pouches or sections are more discrete. I like that I can lock the bag, both the front compartment and main compartments (these have separate locks) so that I can keep confidential material reasonably secure and well organized. A spot to carry a drink on the outside would be nice, but a great case nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Earl

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: This case is falling apart so quickly it's insane. It only gets used about 2 times per week and very briefly, but by looking at it, one might think it was taken on some excursion. The hardware falls off, the front pocket is no longer in tact, and the top panel is warping so it's difficult to secure the locks. The only two pros: 1. The wheels and rolling system work well still and 2. It holds a good amount of items.
customer_reviews.author: Savy_pi

customer_reviews.title: Very large to hold a 2" binder
customer_reviews.text: I love the professional look of this bag. It says I am a working person. My company is here to stay. You will love this case and it has lots of pockets also. Great buy and worth the money. This is an investment in your company. In you.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great for daily use
customer_reviews.text: I had previously purchased one of these for my husband with no issues. His coworker fell in love with it so I purchased a 2nd one and it's just as great as the first! Strong and durable quality and stands up to daily use. Would definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Spicy Cinnabun

customer_reviews.title: A bit big, but I love the look
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than I thought it would be, but I love it. I use it daily in the rain and snow and I have not had any problems - it’s been about 2 months. Looks nice & professional, but is pretty big & heavy. Holds a lot of things & has a key to lock the front section. Overall I love it. Hasn’t messed up once.
customer_reviews.author: CRJS2013

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR PILOTS!!
customer_reviews.text: If you are a pilot DO NOT get this!! I just finished training and it is already showing wear. The front pocket lock has already broken off so the pocket just flaps freely now. The top does not fully open so getting books out can be a hassle and most importantly the locks stick and I'm sure they will stop working very soon. I fear one day I will not be able to get my jeps out because they are jammed shut.
customer_reviews.author: JAM

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR AIRPLANE TRAVEL
customer_reviews.text: I take multiple international trips 3-4 times a year for work. Thought this would be a great little briefcase to keep my laptop and paperwork in. Everything fit perfectly, BUT IT WAS A PAIN TO TAKE AS A CARRY ON. IT DOESN'T FIT THROUGH THE AIRPLANE ISLES. I HAD TO CARRY IT, AND THIS THING IS HEAVY! I'm a 5'2 female, so I couldn't manage sadly. Gave it to my 6'2 boss instead for his travels, and it was a pain for him as well. He ended up just giving it back to me. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: aroosa shaikh

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I received this briefcase on October 1, 2016. On January 19, 2017, only after three months, the retractable handle is no longer operative. Even prior to that, the seams started to come apart. I only had up to November 1, 2016 to return this item.
customer_reviews.author: Koffee

customer_reviews.title: Poor Qualify
customer_reviews.text: I use this often to haul files and a laptop. The structural material is way too weak for a bag of this price. The lid eventually gave way from simply carrying the bag by the handle of all things. It works well until it falls apart. My previous case (different brand) went ten years before the telescoping handle gave way. I would give it a 1 but it was useful in terms of design. Plan on purchasing one every two years if you go with this one.
customer_reviews.author: B. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Great size, not so great materials
customer_reviews.text: Great size case, but horrible build materials. The clasp on front pocket broke almost immediately and the "leather look" exterior showed wear withing a few months, especially on the front and side pockets. The worst part is that the wheels on this case lasted about a year. The bearings rusted and started making am embarrassingly loud noise when rolled. You could hear me coming from 100 yards out! Too bad because I travel a lot and needed a larger rolling case like this.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel P

customer_reviews.title: some issues
customer_reviews.text: This briefcase is huge. If you have more papers then it can hold, you really need to switch to filing boxes and a trolly. Customer service through Apline Swiss is great. The handle on my first one broke within 2 weeks, and I had a new one shipped by the next day. Bad- the material on the outside doesn't look cheap, but it cannot handle any wear and tear. I roll mine in downtown Houston all day. The back-lower portion of the case came apart. The material is hanging in shreds from the back of the case, and there is ugly carboardish material underneath. Not bad for the price. Just don't plan on using this for years
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Whish I'd  had this years ago
customer_reviews.text: I got this for work since I have to carry a lot of paperwork and my shoulder can no longer handle the weight. Easy to access all my documents and hold all my need offices supplies.
customer_reviews.author: Ada

customer_reviews.title: You can use it for anything.
customer_reviews.text: I use this briefcase to hold my cosmetics and creams when traveling to beauty expos. I had my old one for over 20 years and I know this one will last just as long. You can use it for anything. It’s very versatile with a lot of room for storage. It’s also unisex. Great quality too.
customer_reviews.author: Anichka

customer_reviews.title: 17” laptop case on wheels
customer_reviews.text: Great product. However, I’ve been using 3+years and the top creases are cracking open. But, I carry my computer and 3” notebook to the office every week so I guess it works as well as can be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra R. Gillion

customer_reviews.title: Looks sharp, and it's huge
customer_reviews.text: If you want a really roomy, professional-looking bag so you can lug books or documents along with your laptop, this might be the bag for you. While it's not leather, it does appear to be high quality. I ended up returning it though, because I didn't pay enough attention to the dimensions posted, and it was just too big for my needs. It hit me in the legs sometimes as I walked because it was so wide. I also had trouble with one of the latches sticking sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Kayleen

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: The size is great and holds my 19" laptop. The quality is pretty good although the outside clasp is hard to work and the top opening is stiff and hard to keep open. But it does work great for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: jill harmon

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a professional lawyer case holder
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for school it’s a great size and you won’t kill your back but haven’t used it yet but still looks good for when I bought it it’s also Swiss and is therefore great quality
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but....
customer_reviews.text: When I received this product, there were some scratches at the bottom. Some areas the stitching was coming undone. It took me a while to use it so it sat in my room still in package. By the time I noticed the problems, the return window had already closed. As some people said, there is also the problem with on of the flaps not opening all the way. It was very hard for me to get my laptop in there. I had to ask an acquaintance to hold the flap for me. Other than that, I do love this product. I think mine was just an isolated case. The manufacturer just needs to have better quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Supermoto

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with this choice thus far
customer_reviews.text: I researched this type rolling briefcase for a couple of months before purchasing. I am very pleased with this choice thus far. It has useful pockets throughout and is well constructed, seems durable. I only wish the wheels were 360degree rollers, it would just make it more convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Strong, sturdy bag ready to roll out
customer_reviews.text: What a great bag! I just got it today, and it is very sturdy and strong. It is a stiff bag, the inside has ample room for numerous items. The side pockets are great too. It's a very stiff bag, but it reminds me of the samsonite gorilla commercials of the 70's. I don't think a gorilla could crush this one. It's a serious bag for serious business, and what a great price from amazon! No regrets. This will be holding files, my lunch, cell phone and whatever else I can stuff inside of it.
customer_reviews.author: amazoner

customer_reviews.title: very nice except for one annoying thing
customer_reviews.text: great brief case but the flap on the side where the pull up handle is doesn't open and flap back which is really annyong. other than than it is great
customer_reviews.author: Sher

customer_reviews.title: This briefcase is exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: The case is sturdy and nice looking. The handle is strong and works easily. It has good capacity for the items I need to carry in it and it serves as a base for my gear in my mobile office. This is much nicer than the one I replaced with it and at a much better price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T  Walker

customer_reviews.title: jammed lock
customer_reviews.text: The materials look fine, the case has a nice look. The lock to the front pocket was jammed. When I asked the seller a question, they suggested I use the keys--as if I didn't already try that! I saw one other reviewer say the same thing about the lock--so if you happen to get a case with no problems, it's a 5 star case. If you get a jammed lock--well, have fun with that.
customer_reviews.author: J. D.

customer_reviews.title: Not just for pilots
customer_reviews.text: A very likeable briefcase with rolling wheels and more space than average laptop briefcases or messenger bags. Laptops, phones, documents and maybe snacks and lunch can all be squeezed into its confines. The disadvantange is its shorter towing handle and a lack of "spinner" wheels to allow pushing/towing through revolving doors/turnstiles/gates with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Forth Wright

customer_reviews.title: The Rolling Alpine 17” briefcase had no product integrity
customer_reviews.text: I purchased This product to carry my 17” laptop as I move from job site to job site , it rolls well but within a few weeks I started to notice sections where the black material on the outside peeling off revealing a white surface underneath. This became an eyesore for me. In my line of work perception is paramount. I would like this replaced with something comparable if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Karlene

customer_reviews.title: Like it and would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: The size is perfect to place it next to my copilot seat in a 767-300. The material looks good. Although I am aware that for the price it will not last more than a couple years, I thing it doesn`t look that weak. Easy to move. 4 stars because I do think it should have more compartments or divisions inside. After all, I do recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Sotomayor V

customer_reviews.title: TOP NOTCH - excellent case, excellent price!!!
customer_reviews.text: A LOVELY case! I did return it because (my error) I didn't realize it was hard-sided. But it is absolutely GORGEOUS - 100% top quality and extremely well built. I just was wanting a soft-sided case. I am buying an extremely similar soft-sided case from the same seller.
customer_reviews.author: SW

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction
customer_reviews.text: This is not well made. Leather over compressed paperboard. It fell apart in less than 4 months of use. Button feet fell off. Roller feet collapsed into the paperboard substrate. Roller wheel frame broke in half. Holds a 17" laptop. It would be a nice piece of luggage if it were in any way durable.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Attache Lawyers case
customer_reviews.text: I love the matte sheen but the wheels are pretty close to the ground. I had a Solo previously and the wheels were pretty high. This case is very roomy. I don't like the front and side pockets as they are very narrow and can barely hold my phones and other paraphernalia. The price was great. some of the fixtures respond very cheaply though. Sometimes it feels like it wants to be a cheap item. It is very wide and able to hold large files for Court. For the price it is OK.
customer_reviews.author: Linda G.

customer_reviews.title: durable, large
customer_reviews.text: The bag is large and has durable sides which I needed. The extendable handle falls down sometimes but this product is very sturdy. I would recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Radcliffe

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: This case simply didn't hold up. 1 day into a trial and the handle is stuck again and the black pleather coating is coming off the case. Very disappointed in the durability of this product.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: Good Product for a Teacher!
customer_reviews.text: Very usable case . I am a teacher and I carry a lot of stuff daily. This is a nice case for the price. Wheels work well, 'leather' material looks good and holds up. One complaint is the handle wiggles a lot and collapses on me now and then. I am short...5feet 3inches and I find that the handle is ok but I wish it could be shorter. The space inside fits my laptop and plan book, files etc. Pocket on outside is great for umbrella. I would recommend this if you want a reasonably priced product that will keep your items protected, and looks professional as well.
customer_reviews.author: RJU

customer_reviews.title: Durable!
customer_reviews.text: This rolling brief case has been a lifesaver! It Holds all my work files to and from different schools, along with my laptop, and other items. It is easy to roll, and love that you can make your own combination. I have walked outside in heavy rain and none has seeped through! You won’t regret buying it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Appearance
customer_reviews.text: I was excited that the Rolling Briefcase came early, but it did have some scratch marks on the back of the case. It was supposed to be in mint condition and came with marks and scratches on the back. Other than that, it seems to be ok.
customer_reviews.author: HBernie

customer_reviews.title: Great case.
customer_reviews.text: Great case...for a while. Front clasp came off after about 6 months, even though I rarely used the front compartment. One of the locks would not open shortly after that - had to pry it open and pretty much destroy the lock. Telescoping handle is great and size is great for 17" laptops. Wheels starting to make more noise. I still gave it 4 stars because I have been hauling either 4x 17" laptops or 3 of them with 2x 13" laptops. Total weight is usually around 35-40lbs that I've been muling it with.
customer_reviews.author: John Wick

customer_reviews.title: I order this item on 9/16/2016 and as of 2/26/2017 it worked fine. Also the skin had cracked and separated on ...
customer_reviews.text: This item handle will not pull up and there is no access to try to fix the problem. I order this item on 9/16/2016 and as of 2/26/2017 it worked fine. Also the skin had cracked and separated on the edges. I would not purchase any of Alpine inventory again there should be a way to get your money back for an item that doesn't last a 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great for attorneys
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. The first one lasted 3 years and I used it 5 days a week for transporting files and laptop to and from court and office. I love it. Legal Size for Legal files.
customer_reviews.author: HappyDays

customer_reviews.title: Just like any lit bag but the wheels seem sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Bought for work going to/from the courthouse. Several others in my office have one and the only issue I've seen (not with mine) is a handle broke but was replaced with part of a hockey stick (not sure they "classed it up" any) and still does the job. Just like any lit bag but the wheels seem sturdy. My only negative is I'm taller (6'5") and the arm isn't the longest in the world (catch my heal every once in a while).
customer_reviews.author: TES

customer_reviews.title: Very bad quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this laptop case, bag, holder or whatever you call it back in October when I just lost my job. Haven’t been back to work yet and haven’t even used it but I noticed there is a big crack on top where the bag opens and closes. Not sure how this item has 5 stars but very cheap material were used to make it. Can’t even return it and I paid around $80 dollars for it.
customer_reviews.author: JANET VARTANIAN

customer_reviews.title: about as sturdy as a Uhaul cardboard box....
customer_reviews.text: Feels like someone wrapped cardboard with cheap plastic... Top plastic trim already fell off.... Almost impossible to open the front pocket not that the lock is secure but rather so cheap its hard to open... My suggested MSRP approx. $35.
customer_reviews.author: BLUE

customer_reviews.title: An Ideal Briefcase for a Business Person
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my grandson who started a business of his own. He loved it and has been using it daily. It has a large capacity and since his line of work includes taking medicines with him, he can acomodate the medicines as well as the papers because it has compartments to keep different things separate. It is well made and the rolling casters work well. I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: telescoping handle broke on day 1
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice bag for an attorney, and my husband loves it. A big problem is the handle would not fold back and broke on the day 1! So we are returning the bag and ordered a replacement. We llike to stick to it, as it is a very good size and well designed bag. Hopefully this issue won't happen on the next one we are getting, but I wish they would make the telescoping handle a bit stronger. Then this bag would be perfect!
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Very useful!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time in excellent condition! Very useful as a student returning to college!
customer_reviews.author: William Meriwether Black

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Great case. I bought it to use as my traveling case. I can fit everything that I need from my desk into it. 17" laptop, full size calculator, tape dispenser, stapler, many folders, mini ipad, laptop power cord, pens, pencils, pre-inked stamps & more. It gets a little heavy with all of that but that's why it has wheels. I only wish that the both top flaps would fully fold back instead of just 1. I can live with that!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Using it for going to all offices on Capitol Hill..."marble marathon" which requires miles of walking and efficient access to documents--also document care while on the go.
customer_reviews.author: xanetplanet

customer_reviews.title: this case is well made - nice folder pockets
customer_reviews.text: I carry multiple notebooks, files, and computers.... this case is well made - nice folder pockets, great pocket for mouse or power cord inside lid, very functional. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Libbster

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! It is very durable and professional looking. I only wish there would have been directions included with it on how to set the locks. Great value and buy!
customer_reviews.author: MiMi McAfee

customer_reviews.title: Eh.  Not What I wanted. Not functional and its without Instructions
customer_reviews.text: I know there is a side pocket, but I'll be darned if I can get it open. There is a key, a cheap two prong key, and it turns the little lock, but so what. IT won't open. The top flap won't stay open. Doesn't do much as a file holder for me. Not much room for what I intended. Would be better if it had roller wheels in different directions. Would return if I could.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Durable and easy to pull/roll. I would definitely order this bag again!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy B.

customer_reviews.title: Good solid case.
customer_reviews.text: Good solid case. I used it to keep all my most important documents so in case if I need to run out of the house because of sort of disasters, I have everything and just go. The locks are simple enough, and of course, this is not a case for maximum security.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Y Chan

customer_reviews.title: Good buy! Would purchase again, recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this product recommended it to others at my firm. I would purchase it again if need me. Perfect for court.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Has been great! Lots of space and organizational areas
customer_reviews.text: Has been great! Lots of space and organizational areas. Pulls and maneuvers nicely. Looks sharp and proffessional. I am noticing however that the bottom is wearing just as other reviewers had said. the wheels seem to be recessed just a little too much to avoid scrapes and scratches on the bottom. However...I still would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for my 11x17 prints
customer_reviews.text: I haul all my 11x17 art around in this thing to various comic cons, and its just great!
customer_reviews.author: kris keeffer

customer_reviews.title: My Attorney Friends Say this Alpine Swiss Rolling Bag makes me look Smarter
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 19 inch roller bag as it comfortably accommodates my 17 inch laptop plus a few books and notepads ... plus room for snacks and lunch. Pretty handy briefcase and it takes a load off my shoulders ... and a big plus; my attorney friends say it makes me look smarter. I received their compliment with all due magnanimity.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Arrived fast
customer_reviews.text: Wider than anticipated wheels should be a tad bigger to avoid the bottom scraping the ground but overall great quality and sturdy
customer_reviews.author: V. V. W.

customer_reviews.title: Love.....
customer_reviews.text: This is so cool, now most people use their for business and documents as such, no, not me I am a photographer, and I don't like to haul every things I have around, this works for my computer, mobile printer, and two cameras a Canon, and Nikon and some nick nacks, plugs, adapters, etc.... now you can't stuff it, but add what you need, and you will be alright....
customer_reviews.author: Ana M . Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: I'm getting me one.  The true test of a good gift is when you don't want to give it away!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for an employee that just got her law license and started working for me as a new attorney. When it arrived I pulled it out of the box and was instantly jealous. I WANT ONE!!!! I'm getting one for me. I've been looking for a quality nice bag like this for YEARS. I didn't know if the quality would be good like on this one, but it was. I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi

customer_reviews.title: Did NOT stand up to a few weeks of wear and tear.
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve had the wheeled brief case about two weeks now. One of the locks is broken (latch stopped working) and the wheels suddenly became VERY loud this morning. I’m wildly disappointed in this item.
customer_reviews.author: Boop

customer_reviews.title: In line skate wheels.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one 4 years ago and have used it every day for work. The wheel bearings failed and I just received my new one yesterday. I was very pleased to see the case has been upgraded to in line skate wheels. I now expect this case to last much longer than the first.
customer_reviews.author: loyal kropf

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Doctors!
customer_reviews.text: My wife, Doctor loves this for her files and computer. That’s it to the office ever day.
customer_reviews.author: Global American Enterprises Inc.

customer_reviews.title: 2 out of 10
customer_reviews.text: Too small. Front pouch does not close, poorly designed with rounded top - difficult putting stuff in and out. Keep looking
customer_reviews.author: Sloan

customer_reviews.title: great case
customer_reviews.text: ok road warriors:a case you will be proud to wheel behind you at any airport,seminar (also teachers and professors), or sales call. Looks professional, I had to bend down and sniff it, I thought it was leather, actually probably poly, a more durable material. It has more pockets than a high end purse and versatile in actual use. I stuffed many various sized items inside. Can use for digial projectors(most brands), laptops,tablets of course, and files, presentations, and use as luggage for 1-2 day trips. Enjoy! ...on the road again.
customer_reviews.author: bartman

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel and very durable
customer_reviews.text: We use these for our off site testing kits and already have 2 of them. They work great and have plenty of room and different pockets for what we need.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Roberts

customer_reviews.title: love this!
customer_reviews.text: Everyone at school makes fun of me for my rolling bag but I love it. My 17" gaming laptop fits perfectly. It holds that plus most of my text books. I'd need a Walmart buggy to carry all of them but now instead of three heavy bags I carry one light bag and roll all the heavy stuff. I have a deformed ankle and this helps sooooo much! I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Haylie

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Traveling Case
customer_reviews.text: Fits my computer, speakers, projector and space left over for other items and very strong but light weight - much better than expected!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry StockMorris

customer_reviews.title: Wheels small, hard and loud. Can't sneak up on anyone.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty Legit in terms of the case itself. Rain proof, spacious and useable design. My one complaint is that the wheels are super loud, no shock absorption or sound cushioning and I'm worried that they are going to wear out easily. Since people can hear you rolling up from 100 ft. Away don't plan on being able to sneak up on anyone or sneak in late to anything, you will be heard long before you're even seen.
customer_reviews.author: Katie G

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Is a little heavy even when empty but it is so stylish and lots of rooms inside.
customer_reviews.author: Alianet Ojeda

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: the lock is not so good! In 6 months one of the lock broke down 👎👎👎👎👎👎
customer_reviews.author: Juanignaciocastro

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the $
customer_reviews.text: While certainly not top of the line it suits my needs for running to meetings.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Haas

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: This was big and beautiful, but too much bag for me
customer_reviews.author: Mskimo

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BRIEFCASE
customer_reviews.text: I use this as my mobile office as a nurse case manager. Very spacious with multi compartments. The only problem I've encountered is the inability to access the front compartment. Key isn't working or lock is jammed. I'm for tutorials now to make sure this isn't a user error.
customer_reviews.author: Caprini Powell

customer_reviews.title: Carry on brief case
customer_reviews.text: It looked warned out after only a few use ! Not so easy for a lady to maneuver. Stopped using it after few times, as it looks shabby..
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality for the price. I needed a case that could accommodate a heavy load with all the gear. I am so very pleased with this case I am going to order another one for a family member. Sergeant Adrian Martin
customer_reviews.author: A. MARTIN

customer_reviews.title: PEFFECT FOR ANYONE WHO NEEDS A STURDY AND VERSATILE ROLLING /CARRYING CASE FOR OFFICE USE.
customer_reviews.text: Would purchase this again , very good quality and very practical. Works great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Shortt

customer_reviews.title: Wheel your way to success
customer_reviews.text: Definitely helps you organize catalogs, etc. you might need to transport and the wheels makes it easy.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Gastman

customer_reviews.title: I like it OK
customer_reviews.text: I like it OK, but is a lot larger in real life. Have not been able to use it to best advantage. It will take some time to break it in. The case is rigid and looks very nice.
customer_reviews.author: ormartin

customer_reviews.title: Locks break Easly
customer_reviews.text: The bag is Amazing with the space it holds, much bigger than my last one. The water doesn't get in through the extendable handle, which is AMAZING considering my last bag always got water damaged from the extendable handle. I can't give it a better score though, because the lock broke within less than a week of using it (one side won't open anymore)
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great bag and like better than Samsonite
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through several Samsonite rollerbags. I enjoy this one more than the Samsonites. It is also less money. The side pockets are a plus. It is a little wider than the Samsonites I have owned. It appears to be just as durable, but time will only tell. I don't have a problem with the back flap wanting to go down. It is real easy to lift up to put stuff in the bag. It is like having a little helper when you want to close it.
customer_reviews.author: FUN EXPLORER

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, but big, when putting in your car, it carries all my work paper
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette

product_meta.title: Alpine Swiss Rolling 17" Laptop Briefcase on Wheels Attache Lawyers Case Legal Size
feature_bullets: TSA APPROVED CARRY ON SIZE – Measures 19" x 14" x 9" TSA approved carry-on size for all carriers. Interior measurements 17" x 13 1/4" x 7 1/2".
LAPTOP SLEEVE – Main compartment features a divided folder and a padded laptop sleeve with secure elastic strap that fits up to 17” laptop.

SPACIOUS, ORGANIZED, SECURE – Main section flap-over comes with organizer that includes a card slot, two pen slots, and a small zipper pocket that measures 8” x 3” x 1.5”. Closure has secure dual combination locks can be individually set. Front pocket expands 2 inches and has a button latch. Side pockets each measure 6” x 1 3/8” x 9”. Spacious enough for A4 and legal sized documents.

DURABLE CONSTRUCTION - Made with a sturdy hard sided frame to last, riveted attachments for all components like the telescopic rolling handle, carrying top handle, and smooth in-line skate wheels. The leatherette finish adds sophistication and polish to this practical and durable briefcase.
WARRANTY – Comes with a 1-year Alpine Swiss manufacturer’s warranty against defects so you can make your purchase with confidence.
